contents.name: kibana
contents.contents:
We use kibana to analyze and visualize the nginx logs.
It use logstash to post and receive the logs, and elasticsearch to do the searching things.
And it provides a very nice web dashboard.

contents.name: scorer
contents.contents: This is a system that will record the coins and reputation.

contents.name: sentry
contents.contents:
I use sentry to gather our applications exceptions.
Sentry is actually a django project, everyone can build this.
But its document is just like a shit, you can taste it if you don't believe me.
Sentry uses postgres to save all the exceptions. And you should use raven as your client. Raven supports many languages, and it is really easy to use.

contents.name: warning_report
contents.contents:
We build a system to send daily report email about the kuaizhan's data. I make the frontend job.
And i write some scripts that will send emails to all developers if the projects has some big problems. Such as:

contents.name: kuaizhan
contents.contents: I am doing this project right now. Here is the link. Kuaizhan is a tool for all people to build their own wap and apps. My job is building the components and plugins for it and build a system to handler the exceptions online.

contents.name: quanzi
contents.contents:
My first project in sohu -> Quanzi. Inspird By Reddit, we want to build our own reddit. The order of topics is totally depends on user's action.(such as comment count like count dislike count ..) The user can just view their favourite topics by joining the specific 'quanzi' (like douban group). We build a system(Naive Bayes and log the user's passing rate) that can filter the bad topics automatically. Except that, we also has a manage system to audit all the topics and do all admin operations.
We use pure python to build the project. Our database is mongodb(original one is cassandra, but cassandra counter is just a shit, mongodb's counter is a shit too). We use mongokit as the orm/driver(pymongo), it provides document structure and some validator, but it turns out that mongokit is not as good as we expected. We use redis as the cache, and we put the Bayes's sample into it. We also use redis to build our tag search and user notification. Yes we use redis to do a lot of things. Our web server is tornado, it handles the async requests pretty well, but it has the memory leak problem(slowly). So we restart our tornado process every week. We use nginx to do the proxy pass and loading balance. We have 6 versions online and we can change between 6 versions within a blink(just one fabric command and no waiting). Our backend just give the json data, page rendering is the node.js's bussiness.Yes, we use node to render the template. But we also use backbone to do the frontend MVC thing. Finally, we use sentry to gather all online exceptions, sphinx to write the docs and fabric to do the deployment.

contents.name: smart_router
contents.contents:
This is a project from the hackathon.
We use raspberry pi to build a smarter router.
The route contains the monitor system, it means that it will capture the picture of the house and if someone breaks into the house, it will send a email to you.
And we build OwnCloud on it, so it will be the private cloud service.
We use hostapd isc-dhcp-server and  iptables to do the route things.
Finally, if other people wants to use your router, they should download the specific apps to get the verification code. Maybe this is one way to popularize your apps.
